intro: Tauschia edulis, commonly known as the edible tauschia, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its edible parts include the leaves and roots, which are used in local cuisines for their mild, aromatic flavor. Due to its nutritional value and adaptability, it is of interest for sustainable agriculture in semi-arid regions.
